prompts.title: Entrance
prompts.text:
Write an over-the-top ring entrance package for "" & "".
Include titantron graphics, pyro beats, signature taunts, and a short mic burst from each.
Invent 2–3 finisher names themed to their legacies.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" } HARD RULES: historically respectful; no living people; avoid real brands/songs.
End with a shoutable 4–8 word tag.

prompts.title: Fish
Debate
Duet
Docu
Montage
Commentary
Bobross Guest Portrait
prompts.text:
CAST: Bob Ross — Soft-spoken TV painter; calm encouragement.; "" — "".
SET: Cozy studio, easel at frame-left; guest sits on a chair at frame-right.
FORMAT (enforce):
- [WIDE] Palette tap; gentle intro from Bob Ross.
- [TWO-SHOT] "": 1–2 lighthearted lines about posing.
- [CUT-IN] Brush swish; Bob Ross offers soothing guidance and a happy accident joke.
- [PING-PONG] Short back-and-forth banter (2–3 exchanges).
- [FINALE] Reveal the portrait; mutual smiles; soft chuckle.
DIALOGUE: Keep voices in-character; warm, kind humor; no brands or real songs.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Bobross Multiverse Duo
prompts.text:
CAST: Bob Ross — Kind, serene mentor; happy little trees.; Bob Ross — A parallel Bob—slightly different cadence.
SET: Studio folds into a multi-dimensional space; frames within frames.
FORMAT (enforce):
- [WIDE] Palette clink; painter greets guest Bob.
- [SPLIT-FRAME] Tiny portals show rapid variations of their banter across universes.
- [PING-PONG] 3–4 quick exchanges riffing on "happy accidents" and mirrored brushstrokes.
- [CASCADE] Snapshots of alternate Bobs nodding in approval (no brands/songs).
- [FINALE] Reveal a surreal portrait containing nested portraits of Bob Ross.
DIALOGUE: Gentle, humorous, supportive; stay true to persona.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Bobross Crowd Multiverse
prompts.text:
CAST: Bob Ross (primary painter) and Bob Ross (guest), plus a crowd of hundreds of Bob Ross variants painting outdoors.
SET: Open meadow; easels forming concentric rings; soft breeze; birds (generic).
FORMAT (enforce):
- [AERIAL] A sea of afros and easels; gentle murmur of approval.
- [TWO-SHOT] Primary painter Bob chats with guest Bob (2–3 lines each).
- [CUTAWAYS] Different Bob variants add tiny details in parallel universes.
- [MONTAGE] Rapid micro-interactions (3–4 beats) with playful, wholesome humor.
- [FINALE] Pan out to reveal a multi-dimensional portrait blooming across the field.
DIALOGUE: Wholesome, encouraging; character-faithful; avoid brands/songs.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Podcast Scene
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- TITLE: Catchy podcast episode title with a hint at the twist.
- SETTING: Sound-treated studio; close mics; cozy lighting; cups of coffee.
- HOST: "" — ""
- GUEST: "" — ""
- DIALOGUE: Naturalistic, quick but clear; occasional (overlapping), (laughs).
- BEATS: cold open hook -> topic pivot -> surprising reveal -> callback -> sign-off.
- SHOT LIST: Establishing wide -> alternating close-ups -> two-shot for punchlines -> waveform LED cutaway.
- AUDIO: Subtle foley (chair creak, page flips) and room tone.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Newscast Scene
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- PROGRAM: Evening news; neutral lower-thirds; no real logos.
- ANCHOR (studio): "" — ""
- REPORTER (field): "" — ""
- FLOW: headline cold open -> anchor intro -> live toss -> on-site color -> quick vox pop -> back to desk.
- VISUALS: OTS graphics; satellite delay micro-pauses; IFB taps.
- TONE: Crisp, factual, non-partisan.
- B-ROLL: 3 short illustrative cutaways; describe generically where brands would appear.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Presidential Speaking
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- SETTING: Formal podium; flags; press pool; teleprompter glass.
- SPEAKER: "" — "" — inclusive, civic tone; no campaign language.
- SUPPORT: "" — "" — acts as press secretary/ASL interpreter/aide.
- STRUCTURE: acknowledgement -> main initiative -> brief human story -> call to unity -> measured close.
- DEVICES: light anaphora, triads; avoid slogans.
- CUTAWAYS: respectful audience reactions; note-taking reporters; flashes; no chants.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Panel Roundtable
prompts.text:

- FEATURED GUEST: "" — ""
- ADDITIONAL GUESTS: 2 invented neutral personas for contrast.
- FLOW: moderator intro -> turn-taking -> brief clash -> clarifying summary -> lightning-round takeaways.
- SPEAK TAGS: Prefix lines with SPEAKER:. Cross-talk short and readable.
- CAMERA: opening wide -> singles for hot takes -> overhead for crosstalk -> closing wide with sting.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

- CUTS: Split screens; gloved hands; generic badges (no brands/gov logos).
- BUTTON: Cheer that stays professional.

- DISCLAIMER: No endorsements; generic language only.
- BUTTON: A playful non-slogan tag.

prompts.title: Taste Test
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: Split-screen blind taste test between two generic brands.
FORMAT:
1) [INTRO] Host frames it as friendly and non-definitive.
2) [A FIRST SIP] "" : 2–3 precise sensory notes.
3) [B FIRST SIP] "" : 2–3 complementary/contrasting notes.
4) [BRAND PERSONA BEAT] silent/minimal nods; outfit colors & subtle logo-styled details emphasized.
5) [DECISION] friendly wrap-up with subjective, non-definitive preference.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }
Use short, cinematic lines; no endorsements/pricing.

prompts.title: Mall Cop Chase
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: Overdramatic mall security chase through a food court.
FORMAT:

  - DIALOGUE: "" (rookie mall cop) vs "" (alleged pretzel bandit). Rapid exchanges, whistle blasts, absurd PA announcements.
  - GAGS: 3 escalating sight gags (e.g., mobility scooter drift, pretzel‑tongs nunchucks, inflatable mascot tackle).
  - BUTTON: Freeze‑frame citation written like a movie poster tagline.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Awkward First Date Speedrun
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: A first date performed like a video‑game speedrun.
FORMAT:
  - HUD: Minimal on‑screen timers/checkpoints described in brackets.
  - DIALOGUE: Staccato, polite chaos; glitch‑skip small talk; any % PB energy.
  - SPLITS: 4 micro‑sections (Meet, Order, Vulnerable Overshare, Goodbye) with comedic time saves.
  - FAILSTATE: 1 hilarious soft‑reset (spilled drink, wrong name, etc.).
  - COMMENTARY: A deadpan announcer calls out ‘gold splits.’
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Time Travel Customer Support
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: A customer support line that takes calls from different centuries.
FORMAT:

  - QUEUE: 4 ultra‑short calls (medieval scribe, 1920s inventor, far‑future teen, Paleolithic hunter).
  - ISSUE CARDS: Each call has a one‑line ‘ticket title’ and a quirky resolution.
  - HOLD MUSIC: Describe it humorously once.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Heist Planning Groupchat
prompts.text:

  - THREADS: 3 sub‑threads (blueprints, disguises, alibi).
  - TWIST: A helpful janitor quietly does the heist mid-chat.
  - BUTTON: A triumphant ‘mission accomplished’ typo.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

  - BUTTON: The ghost now handles weekly reports.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: WWF 90s Era Tag Team Promo
prompts.text: Create a realistic wwe tag team promo with "" and "", and allow both of them to say a few words. Make it funny, and entertaining like a real wwe promo. Create it in the 90s era style wwf. The characters should be as close to their originals as possible.

prompts.title: Bob Ross Paints Someones Car
prompts.text: Create a scene for bob ross painting ""'s car. Make a funny back and forth exchange with the awkward moment and anger, sarcasm, etc from persons car owner. Let both of them say a few words back and forth. Make it funny and entertaining. The characters should respond in line with their character traits, and the car should match the style of the person. Also make sure the voices match the correct person talking.

prompts.title: Bob Ross Paints A Guest In A Chair
prompts.text: Create a scene in the style of bob ross painting a portrait of a guest sitting in a chair next to him, but the twist is bob ross is the one getting the portrait done of him by another person. The other person is going to do the painting. The guest is "". Let both of them say a few words back and forth. Make it funny and entertaining. The characters should respond in line with their character traits.

prompts.title: Price Is Right Contestant's Row Winner
prompts.text: Create a realistic "price is right" game intro scene with bob barker and a guest who won the bidding game. The guest is "", and allow both of them to say a few words. Make it funny, and entertaining like a real aired tv show. Create it in the 80s era style. The characters should be as close to their originals as possible.

prompts.title: Slap Fight
prompts.text: Create a realistic slap fight contest between "" and "". Make the characters as close to their actual counterparts as possible. It should have the classic smack talk and chalking before the slap.

prompts.title: COPS Interaction: Funny
prompts.text: Create a scene in the style of the show "COPS" where "" is being questioned about something and probably getting detained or arrested. Make it funny. Allow the perp and the police officer(s) to each say a couple funny but believable and semi-serious lines back and forth. Make it seem real. Put the text of what the person is accused of or did in a news chyron. Make the news station believable, but funny. Its a normal interaction, and they dont look at the camera.

prompts.title: Magic Genie Lamp: Funny
